div.head: Boundary Dispute between Asseria and Alveria

p.seg: This text, discovered at modern Dobropoljci in Croatia, NB, at Wilkes 1974, 262 no. 11 the findspot is described as “probably Alveria,” but now see BAtlas 20 C5 following Miletić 1993, 69. just south of ancient Alveria (mod. Gradina in Bjelina) records the appointment of several otherwise unknown individuals with tria nomina as iudices dati in a boundary dispute between Asseria (mod. Podgrađe near Benkovac) and Alveria.

div.ab:
[Cl]audius L[ --- ]
Avilius Clemen[s],
Coelius Capella, P(ublius)
ecius Libo, P(ublius) Valeri
Secundus iudices
ati a M(arco) Pompeio Silva
no leg(ato) Aug(usti) pro pr(aetore) inter
rem p(ublicam) Asseriatiut rem p(ublicam) Al
veritarum inpraesenti per
[sententi]determinaverunt.

div.p: Tiberius Claudius L[- - -], Gaius Avilius Clemens, Lucius Coelius Capella, Publius Raecius Libo, Publius Valerius Secundus, iudices appointed by Marcus Pompeius Silvanus, propraetorian imperial legate, established the boundary between the res publica of the Asseriates and the res publica of the Alveritae through their own verdict in the current case.
